intro: Melanthium junceum, commonly known as slender false flax, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Melanthium junceum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
